name: The Hassan Foundation
mission: TO PROMOTE HUMAN DEVELOPMENT BY PRESERVING LIFE THROUGH IMPROVING HEALTH AND EDUCATION AMONGST THE POOR PEOPLE IN PAKISTAN. TO PROVIDE CLEAN POTABLE WAT...
theoryOfChange: Providing clean water reduces disease and frees time for education; supporting orphans' education breaks the cycle of poverty; vocational training creates economic independence.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Hassan Foundation explicitly states, "Will my donation be zakat eligible? All of Hassan Foundation's projects are exclusively for zakat-eligible people." Additionally, they mention, "In addition to receiving donations and zakat money, Hassan Foundation collects funds through our annual fundraising event". (Source: https://hassanfoundationusa.org/donate/)

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 34/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those seeking Zakat-eligible causes and religious-cultural urgency [1][3]. The organization facilitates these contributions by offering specific donation channels for Zakat and Sadaqah to support its humanitarian work in Pakistan [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a direct service model with an impact score of 32/50, maintaining a program expense ratio of 88.2% and significant working capital of 99.7 months [2][3]. However, the data confidence is low (0.3), suggesting a need for more transparent reporting on the specific effectiveness of its water and education programs [2].

In the 2022 fiscal year, the foundation reported a total revenue of $586,737 to fund its mission of preserving life among the poor [2].

Value a high percentage of funds going directly to the field
Prefer supporting established organizations with a long history in Pakistan
giving_considerations: The organization has significant cash reserves but declining annual revenue

Limited external data is available beyond tax filings

strengths.detail: The foundation directs <cite id="2">88.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core programs, ensuring that nearly all donor funds reach beneficiaries.
The organization reports a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="3">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, maximizing the impact of every dollar.
With <cite id="3">99.7 months of working capital</cite> in reserves, the foundation has a strong safety net to sustain operations during economic volatility.

strengths_deep_dive: The Hassan Foundation's financial health is characterized by its ability to maintain <cite id="2">$2,501,272 in total assets</cite> while keeping overhead costs remarkably low. This fiscal discipline is evidenced by its <cite id="3">100% independent board</cite>, which provides rigorous oversight of its <cite id="2">$289,077 in foreign grant distributions</cite>. Furthermore, the foundation's focus on <cite id="1">clean water and education</cite> aligns with high-urgency humanitarian needs in Pakistan, allowing for a direct service delivery model that bypasses complex administrative layers.
rich_narrative.summary: The Hassan Foundation is a faith-based humanitarian organization established in <cite id="3">2007</cite> with a mission to preserve life and promote human development in <cite id="3">Pakistan</cite>. The organization focuses on critical infrastructure and social services, specifically <cite id="1">clean water projects, education support, and orphan care</cite>. In the 2022 fiscal year, the foundation managed <cite id="2">$586,737 in total revenue</cite>, primarily sourced from <cite id="2">$580,099 in public contributions</cite>. A defining characteristic of the foundation is its lean operational model, which allows it to maintain a <cite id="2">88.2% program expense ratio</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="3">industry standard of 75%</cite>. The foundation operates as a grantmaker for international relief, directing <cite id="2">$289,077 in foreign grants</cite> to support direct service delivery in impoverished regions. By focusing on high-impact, life-saving interventions like <cite id="1">potable water and disaster relief</cite>, the organization addresses the immediate needs of <cite id="3">fuqara and masakin</cite> (the poor and needy) while maintaining <cite id="3">100% independent board oversight</cite> to ensure fiduciary responsibility.
